page.title: 04HOUSING, APPLETON AND HORNBY
page.content: There are several distinct kinds of housing in Appleton.First the older attractive mainly terraced housing of varying size along Front St. and Baker St. Then there are three groups of council houses,six at the junction Baker St. and Front St, eleven pensioners bungalows at Smithy Green and twenty semi-detached houses at Prospect View.Early in 1985 the latter were updated by the additon of double glazing and solid fuel central heating.Third there is Hunters Ride and the Paddock a small estatate of thirty five three and four bedroomed detached houses and bungalows,built by Bovis homes in the 70's.Lastly there are individualy built homes usually detached on infill plots on the South side of the village and along Hornby road.Apart from the council houses most homes in the village are owner
